> setUp and tear down are used for each testcase, but it would be enough
> to run them once. There is an example in the FAQ but I couldn't find
> out, how to get it running.

The rationale of the system is that each test must be independent of others.
That's why setUp() and tearDown() are called for each single test case. Why
do you want to setUp and tearDown your text fixture only once?

Anyway, if you really want to do this you can do either of these two ugly
things:

- Write your own testSetUp() method as the first test method in the class
and testTearDown() as the last test method in the class. Pretty ugly, but it
should work. I didn't try it myself, so I'm not 100% sure it will.

- If tearDown() is not really necessary, you can declare a static test
fixture and initialize it at the point of definition:

public class InformationDirectoryTest extends TestCase {

  private static SomeClass obj = new SomeClass();

  <tests>
}
